fields.headline: Somewhere in Britain
fields.bodyText: Trees and roots Climb the family tree. Get expert advice on how to go about researching its branches at the Family History Fair, organised by the Society of Genealogists. Royal Horticultural Society's Halls, Greycoat Street and Vincent Square, London SW1. 10am - 5pm, today and tomorrow. £4 - lectures £2 extra. Tel: 020-7251 8799. Spring awakening Tulips, daffodils and hyacinths will be out in glorious profusion in Spalding this weekend. A procession of floats leaves Springfields Show Gardens at 2pm today. The floats are on show in the gardens - with craft stalls and entertainment - throughout tomorrow and Monday. Gardens open 9am - 6pm. Adults £6, seniors £5, accompanied children under 16 free. Tel: 01775 724843. Spirit guide Nosings, tastings, distillery visits and advice from experts are on offer at the Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival. Not to mention celtic music and ceilidhs. Until Monday evening. Check times of events at www.dufftown.co.uk. Tel: 01340 821097. Steaming Ride in steam-hauled vintage railway carriages with staff in Edwardian dress at the Midland Railway Centre. Trains make one- hour round trips every 35 minutes. Butterley Station, Ripley, Derbyshire. Trains run 10.45am - 4.20pm, today, tomorrow and Monday. Adults £8.95, two children free then £4.50 each, over 50s £7.50. Tel: 01773 747674. Upwardly mobile The sky will be bright with hot-air balloons over the Tyne. They lift off today, tomorrow and on Monday from Newcastle Racecourse. Plus jugglers, sideshows, bouncy castle, quad bikes, side stalls and refreshments. Hot-air balloon festival, From 6pm today, 11am Sunday. Adults £6.50, children under 14 £4.50. Tel: 0797 4686791. Past masters Experience the lives of a Victorian family and its servants at Stockport's Bramall Hall as the 19th century is revived during a living history weekend. Today and tomorrow. 11am - 5pm. Adults £4.95, children from £3, families £12.50. Tel: 0161-485 3708. Whodunnit? Play giant Cluedo at Appuldurcombe House on the Isle of Wight. Clues will be left in the Great Hall and the body might be in the cellar or the drawing room. Wroxall, Ventnor. 10am - 4pm. Adults £2, children £1 plus £1 per "detective". Tel: 01983 852 484. Small is beautiful Master the art of Bonsai. Demonstrations and advice are on offer at Leonardslee Gardens. Lower Beeding, Horsham, West Sussex. 9.30am - 6pm, today, tomorrow and Monday. Adults £7, children £3. Tel: 01403 891212.
